meanings.sent1: The extreme cold was embrittling the metal, causing it to crack easily.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the sun's rays can have an embrittling effect on plastic materials.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell unexpectedly started embrittling the stones in the castle walls.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words spoken by the teacher seemed to be embrittling the student's confidence.
meanings.sent5: The relentless pounding of the waves embrittling the once sturdy ship, making it vulnerable to leaks.

meanings.definition: To make or become more brittle.
meanings.sent1: The lack of moisture in the air was embrittling the old documents, making them fragile.
meanings.sent2: The repeated bending of the wire was slowly embrittling it, making it prone to snapping.
meanings.sent3: The constant exposure to heat was embrittling the plastic toys, causing them to break easily.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter conditions were embrittling the tree branches, making them susceptible to snapping.
meanings.sent5: The embrittling effect of the chemical reaction caused the rubber to lose its flexibility.
